attributes.action: Make publicly available on-line full details of MP's expense claims
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I propose that full details of each MP's expense claims should be published on the internet allowing the public to view at any time what each Member of Parliament has claimed and when, and whether or not the claim has been paid. 

This will work much in the same way that we can look up details of an MP's representations in the House of Commons. It will also enable the public to challenge their MP if they feel an inappropriate claim has been made, much in the same way an employer will challenge their employees expenses if they feel they are extravagant or inappropriate.

The full details of the expense allowances should also be published on the same website. This will provide us the public with transparency and disclosure, and also protect MP's from attracting bad press for embarrassing expense claim reports in the press.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament. http://www.parliament.uk/
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
